intro: Ornithogalum humile, commonly known as the dwarf star-of-Bethlehem, is a small, flowering plant native to southern Africa. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of white, star-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. The plant is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is a member of the Asparagaceae family and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Due to its delicate appearance, it is sometimes grown in gardens as a shade-loving plant.
